content: App is fine but, the accounting on my account is in error.

Really don't like the company I can't have access to my money, have to have some stupid hardship with documents. I'll be closing the account soon.

Time to move to Fidelity? Vanguard obviously isn't listening to its customers. I used to love this app, but it literally gets worse with every update. Looking at other reviews, I'm not the only one. Vanguard needs to replace whoever is in charge of this mess. How can a modern app be worse than it used to be 5 years ago? I can no longer sort my orders by symbol, and major trading functionality is buggy, preventing me from creating sell orders. Shameful!

App worked fine last year. Now with changes it's not user friendly. I Hate it. Last year worked fine. Now all my stocks are scrambled and not in Alphabetical order. I don't get any text notifications when I buy or sell. This is the worst I have ever seen. PLEASE FIX THIS DAM THING . It's losing me money RM

Order was executed by the app in mistake and Vanguard refused to correct the mistake. Tried to cancel an oder 3 minutes before market opening, but the request was pending there until the order was executed when the market opened. Updates 10/7/2024: another order executed by mistake. Picked the shares for sell by Spec IDs, but executed by FIFO. Had to call in and wait for more than half an hour. It's very frustrating.

Constantly shuts down. The app runs for about 2 minutes, then shuts down. The session however, continues to be active (but inaccessible and off-screen). If you wait long enough , you will get a notice stating the session has timed out. Forces you to re-log into the app. This happens so frequently that the app becomes unusable. I have not been able to explore any features in the app. I also have concerns about the session remaining active, without any access to it.

Vanguard's web infrastructure is such garbage. They locked my account because apparently I committed the cardinal sin of using a VPN while trying log in. They claim that you can call them on Saturday to fix this, which is plainly not true. So they just managed to inconvenience me for no reason and make it more difficult for me to manage my finances on the weekend when I actually have time to do it. Thanks for nothing! I'm moving to another broker that isn't a dumpster fire.

It astonishes me that a financial giant like Vanguard does not invest in providing a quality app experience to their customers through this app. The app is primitive and has been so for so many years. I hope the feedback falls on right ear and the team gets a decent budget to fund some of the much needed upgrades on UI framework as well as the backend design for all optimization needs.

Horrible app and now Vanguard is an awful company. They auto changed a 401K account without my permission and changed my statement preferences. Then proceeded to charge me $25! I call to explain what happened and get told tough luck. Well guess what my sizeable account is getting moved ASAP!

The Vanguard app used to be great years ago, they cut out the performance tracking tools that were extremely helpful and left us with an overly simplified dashboard that is largely useless. Every time I open the app it throws up a technical difficulties page or that the site is unavailable requiring me to close the app and reopen. It has been like this for over a year, completely unacceptable for a massive financial company. The trajectory of this app is not promising.

This is my review for the Vanguard app and company as a whole. If I could give 0 stars, I would. Terrible customer service. Fill in your information so we can tell you to call us anyway. Lady I got on the phone might as well have been a robot. They refused to update my email to my current one, the one they have on file is a dead email. It got deleted when my company switched to new ownership. They also want to mail me stuff to the address of someone who no longer works here! VERY unsatisfied!!!

Latest update made this app even worse. Now takes even more steps per trade and defaults to list instead of table, and cuts off holdings titles. Crashes on 1st log in attempt and works on 2nd. Annoying that after completing a trade, it doesn't return you to your list of holdings, but sends you to the main page and you have to drill back down into your list. Fix the stupid feedback pop-ups - they show up at the top of the page so the "x" can't be selected since it's on the status bar.

They replaced one of the best apps in finance with one of the worst. It really boggles my mind at how it's possible to do such a bad job at this.

The Vanguard app used to be an incredible tool to analyze how my investments were allocated. This version takes away all that functionality. I used to use the old version all the time. This one is only good for tracking balances. I rarely use it because I use the Personal Finance app to track all my accounts. I have always been a big advocate for Vanguard but with this move I wouldn't hesitate to move my funds elsewhere.

This isn't a full review. I saw the app ratings. I read reviews. I told myself, "that's not a good look, but if it'll do what I need - even if clunky... well, ok." The ONLY reason I even installed the app was to use the mobile check deposit feature. Maybe I'd use it for more once installed, but that was the catalyst. The app let me get mostly through the deposit setup, but threw errors after taking the front check image. I tried multiple times, tried with Vanguard on the phone (between hold and talk time... > 1 hour): no joy - they even had me uninstall, reboot, & reinstall it (I didn't expect that would help... and it didn't... but I wasn't trying to give the rep grief - he likely didn't make whatever script he was given to walk through with me). It seems Vanguard uploaded version 9.3 as of 6/2 - then I saw someone's review saying they were getting issues with ver. 10.x and *wanted* 9.3, as a more stable build. So, I'm guessing they rolled back to 9.3 due to 10.x complaints... but the check deposit feature was definitely a bust for me in this 'better' version. I hope they get this fully fixed and tested fast, but for now it's deposit checks somewhere else and eTransfer to them... or snail mail checks to Vanguard (missing market days). Definitely a "1st world problem", but a disappointing inconvenience in the modern era and less than I'd expect based on my experience with Vanguard and their reputation. That said, the few other app areas I poked at seemed reasonable enough and gave the info I'd expect about my account, but I didn't try any other transaction types.
